title: Ranked Requirement : Normal Wins
body:
Hey Guys; just wanting to put my opinion down on this; I think this is a rather good idea so I'm going to leave it here for the rest to discuss on what they think on this.


Lately I have been getting this feeling where brand new players; or newer players are finding them selves to try ranked, by all means do but there's just one thing that bothers me when they do. 

 Do they have enough experience to be on the competitive fields of ranked?
*->* Warding, Team fights, Learnt all roles to the best they can, and the communication with the team.

What I was trying to say is, the level 30 requirement to enter ranked just doesn't quite feel enough experience to see where you place; what I was thinking was maybe add a Normal Win Requirement, before they can get into ranked 

EXAMPLE : "Level 30 : 400 Summoner Rift Wins."

I think the 400 is a fair go on this, because they would have enough hours spent into this game to learn most roles to the best they can, and so forth.

I am happy to continue playing ranked; even when the worse scenario hits I will still play happily but.. I just wanted to try get my point out and see what everyone else thinks on this...

|| The people who might have a problem is the people who sell accounts, you can see why. ||

Thank you, 
Hope to see what you think
Lee

replies.body: Why should there be any more requirements? The point of a ranked ladder is to rank people according to their skill, if someone goes into it not knowing what they're doing they will lose alot and drop to a low rank pretty fast, where they can play with similarly skilled players until they improve, there's nothing wrong with that. Having some arbitrary skill requirement beyond knowing the most basic concepts of the game is pointless in my opinion. The barrier to entry is already more than enough (I can't remember how long it took me but I'd say its a couple hundred hours of playtime at least to get level 30).
So the rest suffer along the way?

The world ain't all sunshine and rainbows. It's a very mean and nasty place, and I don´t care how tough you are, it will beat you to your knees and keep you there permanently, if you let it. You, me or nobody, is gonna hit as hard as life. But ain't about how hard you hit, It's about how hard you can get hit, and keep moving forward, how much you can take, and keep moving forward. That´s how winning is done. Now, if you know what you worth, go out and get what you worth. But you gotta be willing to take the hits. And not pointing fingers saying: You ain´t what you wanna be because of him or her or anybody. Cowards do that and that ain´t you! You´re better than that.

400? thats ALOT of wins, i know people that are diamond with less wins in norms, 400 matches at 30 mins average per match, thats 200 hours, and thats if they win 400 in a row, odds are they will only win every second match, which puts it at 400 hours.

So you want new players to not only have to level to 30, but spend 400 hours playing norms, just to be able to get to bronze 5 (because they would have had no actual practice against people with any skill, just more noobs playing norms to get their stats up)

I can understand what your saying, and why your saying it, but the idea of level 30 is that they should have learned by the time they reach it,  and if they want to dive into ranked straight away, then thats their loss (and clearly whoevers team gets them).

How about instead of complaining about new players, you teach them:
1.  instead of saying "stop fucking feeding" | Say "if you use ur e to engage youll do more damage" or "you should probably sit under tower they are getting really OP"
2.  instead of saying "my shit support just KS's and never wards" | say "you should place a ward here" then ping location

Talk to people like they are human beings (fun fact: 99%+ of league players in ranked are actually human) you'll get alot further with them, teach them to play better, and they wont get pissed off and just AFK, or feed on purpose.

This is to everyone who posted currently;

As I said before; multiple times now that this requirement is just an example not full proof.
I currently ran into another new player on this day; my god was that a new experience...
She/He was well mannered; but that still doesn't change the outcome of the game when the lane that person chooses loses hard; just because of the outright experience difference.

I know there is Bronze ; Silver ; Gold for the players who are new and need to learn; I just don't like the fact that other players including my self are punished along the way of climbing I just think it's a good idea..

As much as anyone says that 1-30 is enough, quite frankly I don't think it would be.. Sure it gives enough time for your muscle memory to learn creep scoring etcetc; it just doesn't give enough lane experience as I quoted before most people who ranked these days have over 300-600 | Most People |  ranked games in their division they are facing, as much as YOU think they are the same rank, they're really not just purely out of champion knowledge and game experience.



All I want to point out is; even though that the chances of meeting them again are slim, it's annoying just having it happen.
Mostly your promotion series; everyone knows they hate it, which actually is the only time I see the new players on both sides, or just one.

This is just an idea that I thought that would help a lot of people out, and some people have admitted that this is a good idea which is why I posted here for further reasoning.

Everything here is just an example not full-proof.
